page.title: 17OVERSLEY HILL FARM
page.content: Oversley Hill Farm is situated on an elevated position overlooking Alcester.It has 298.9 acres and about 150 sheep and 40 to 50 beef cattle. On the 298.9 acres Mr Corbett grows grass and hay,and corn to feed the cattle.Silage is made by cutting grass and baling it in to big round bales and putting in to big plastic bags and leaving it for about six months.Then you can feed it to the cattle. The house at Oversley Hill Farm is about A century old.Mr Corbett has traced his family back about 100 years and they all had that Farm.Before the Corbetts the Throckmorton family of Coughton owned the land. Mr and Mrs Corbett have four daughters and so the family farm will continue to flourish into the next century.
